intro: Telipogon sprucei, commonly known as the Andean orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Andes Mountains. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, with a distinct three-lobed lip that is a key feature for pollination. Telipogon sprucei is a rare and specialized species, often found in specific microhabitats within its native range.
